Philippine defence chief vows to protect sovereignty amid secession threatsThe Philippines' defence minister on Monday vowed to "strictly enforce" the country's sovereignty, joining the chorus of security officials pledging to defend the nation following secessionist threats made by former president Rodrigo Duterte. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 06:38:37 GMT JDNLYIZXXRP6JNMNR6PFNDXLPY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/philippine-defence-chief-vows-protect-sovereignty-amid-secession-threats-2024-02-05/Reuters世界亚太地区
France to summon Russia's ambassador - diplomatic sourceFrance will summon Russia's ambassador on Monday after the death of two French humanitarian workers following a Russian strike in Ukraine, and what Paris said was an upsurge in Russian disinformation, a French diplomatic source said. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 06:08:39 GMT TIOE2LTSOBK6DETIXE64OL4XHM https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/france-summon- Russias-ambassador-diplomatic-source-2024-02-05/Reuters世界欧洲
Samsung chief Lee cleared of charges in 2015 merger caseSamsung Electronics Chairman Jay Y. Lee was found not guilty of accounting fraud and stock manipulation by a Seoul court on Monday in a case about a 2015 merger of Samsung affiliates that prosecutors said was designed to cement his control of the tech group. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 06:00:44 GMT KWI4FMG54FLTTC6X73REPHLYZY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/samsung-chief-lee-cleared-charges-2015-merger-case-2024-02-05/Joyce Lee世界亚太地区
Australia and China: rebound in ties threatened by death sentence for Australian writerA Beijing court on Monday handed Australian writer Yang Hengjun a suspended death sentence, threatening a recent rebound in bilateral ties that followed several years of strained relations between Beijing and Canberra. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 05:34:29 GMT FZWK4JOA4JP3VEHMMJBUVLSIVU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/australia-china-rebound-ties-threatened-by-death-sentence-australian-writer-2024-02-05/Reuters世界亚太地区
New Zealand calls for Kiwi pilot to be freed a year after Papua kidnappingNew Zealand has called for the immediate release of Kiwi pilot Phillip Mehrtens, a year after he was taken hostage by rebels in Indonesia's Papua region, its foreign minister said on Monday. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 05:31:10 GMT PDK4NASFUZNOPKEGNXSYRL43PE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/new-zealand-calls-kiwi-pilot-be-freed-year-after-papua-kidnapping-2024-02-05/Reuters世界亚太地区
Senegal should hold presidential vote as soon as possible -African UnionSenegal should hold presidential elections as soon as possible, the African Union (AU) said, days after its President Macky Sall delayed the Feb. 25 vote to an unspecified date. Mon, 05 Feb 2024 05:11:59 GMT N4QJYN7FQRPTFPU4YP4YMBJRKM https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/senegal-should-hold-presidential-vote-soon-possible-african-union-2024-02-05/Reuters世界非洲
Best new artist Grammy winner Victoria Monet follows big namesThe 2024 Grammy Awards may be a launching pad for the best new artist winner, Victoria Monet, who took home the title at Sunday's 66th ceremony. New Zealand expects defence capability report in JuneNew Zealand defence minister Judith Collins said on Monday she expects to receive a review of the country's defence capabilities in June, the latest step in the modernisation of the country's military. Indonesia presidential hopefuls strike conciliatory note ahead of electionIndonesia's presidential candidates struck a conciliatory note in the latest televised debate as the hotly contested race to lead the world's third-largest democracy enters its final stages. Australian war hero appeals defamation ruling on reports he was complicit in Afghan unlawful killingsAn Australian court on Monday began hearing the appeal of a decorated war hero, who is fighting a court defamation ruling that found media groups had proven their reports he played a part in the unlawful killings of four Afghans in Afghanistan.
